title.narrative: Citizenship and gender institutions in Chile: workshops second phase 2015

description.narrative: The second government of Michelle Bachelet has promoted a series of structural reforms. Implicit in these reforms three particularly affect women: the Ministry of Women and Gender Equality Reform the binomial electoral system incorporating gender affirmati ve action in political competition and the voluntary decriminalization of pregnancy in three events (risk of life of the mother risk of fetal life and in case of rape).During the second half of 2015 a series of four workshops will be held which aims to ana lyze the reforms proposed by the second government of Bachelet in gender issues as well as analyze the current status of women in Chile and the current gender policies. The workshops will feature the participation of leading academics and government person alities. These workshops will contemplate a deep reflection and building technical expertise to advance in gender mainstreaming in public policies for Chile.Finally there will be a publication containing the fundamental papers from the series of workshops called Women and the State: Challenges for mainstreaming gender in Chile.The four workshops within the project with the embassy are:a) Why a labor reform in Chile must incorporate a gender perspective?b) Gender and Defense: Strategies for mainstreaming gen der in defense.c) Violence against women in Chile: Challenges for the legislation and the judicial and political institutions in Chile.d) How to mainstream gender in the state and local level? Challenges for Chilean institutions under the new Ministry of W omen.
